text: It's good, but it's not the RPG that you expect.
speaker: A

text: For example, the battles have been stripped away a lot of their RPG elements from the games of series past.
speaker: A

text: The game is all about collecting stickers and using those stickers in battle, and once the sticker is used, it's gone.
speaker: A

text: So the game is more about resource management than strategy or leveling.
speaker: A

text: There's almost no reward for Battles.
speaker: A

text: The only thing you get from battling is coins, and the only thing you spend your coins on are more stickers.
speaker: A

text: In that aspect, the RPG elements are much more airbones, but still has the talent and plenty of side quests for you to do.
speaker: A

text: The game is easy except for boss battles.
speaker: A

text: Those are really tough and causes extreme spikes and difficulty.
speaker: A

text: The 3D effects are excellent and the music is really catchy.
speaker: A

text: It's still a lot of fun to play.
speaker: A

text: I definitely recommend checking it out or buying it if you can find it for a good price.
speaker: A

text: Once you get past and accept the missing RPT elements and take the game for what it is, it's a good game and it's worth your time.
speaker: A

text: Paper Mario StickerStar gets a seven out of ten.
speaker: A
